content: Singaporean businessman (born 1964) **Philip Chan Man Ping** (born 1964) is a [naturalized](/wiki/Naturalization) [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporean) businessman. Born in [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong), Chan is the fifth son in a [Teochew](/wiki/Teochew_people) family. ## Career Chan began his career in [sales](/wiki/Sales), before co-founding a business with his two brothers, overseeing sales and shipping operations in [Vietnam](/wiki/Vietnam), [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong), and [China](/wiki/China). He also served as the managing director of Wen Way Investments and Mutual Benefits Realty, and as the [CEO](/wiki/Chief_executive_officer) of C&H Properties. Additionally, he founded China Link Education Consultancy. Chan was a patron of the [Kampong Chai Chee](/wiki/Kampong_Chai_Chee) Citizens’ Consultative Committee and the [Bukit Timah](/wiki/Bukit_Timah) Community Club management committee. He stepped down from these roles following his designation as a "politically significant person" by Singapore's [Ministry of Home Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(Singapore)), under the country's foreign interference laws. ## Allegations of China influence On 2 February 2024, [Singapore’s Ministry of Home Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Home_Affairs_(Singapore)) designated Chan as a *“politically significant person*" under the Foreign Interference (Countermeasures) Act 2021 ([FICA](/wiki/Foreign_Interference_(Countermeasures)_Act_2021)), citing concerns over his potential susceptibility to foreign influence. He officially became the first person designated as a politically significant person under FICA on 26 February 2024. Journalists noted that the designation was interpreted as reflecting government efforts to counter potential foreign influence, particularly from Chinese sources, in domestic affairs. The [FICA](/wiki/FICA) notice was officially issued to him on 26 February 2024. ## Personal life Chan has [immigrated](/wiki/Immigration) to [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) in 1990, and became a [naturalized citizen](/wiki/Naturalization) in 1993. He is married to a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporeans), and they have two sons. This business-related biographical article from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Philip Chan (businessman)
